Description: To resolve Federal Trade Commission charges, one of the nation's largest debt collectors was ordered to pay $1.75 million for allegedly making repeated telephone calls to collect from the wrong person, to collect the wrong amount, or both.
back pay award in unfair labor practices case
Info Source: Extracted from an NLRB dataset covering 1999-2011 downloaded at https://catalog.data.gov/dataset/nlrb-cats-final-c-case-data-bulk-19990101-20110930-in-xml

Company: Allied Interstate LLC, and iQor Holdings Inc.
Description: Allied Interstate LLC and its parent IQor agreed to pay $8 million penalties and $1 million costs in settlement with 18 California district attorneys of allegations it violated state and federal laws regarding debt collection phone calls, with excessive calling, use of robodiallers, and calling cellphones without consent.

Agency: Arizona Department of Insurance and Financial Institutions
Notes: This case was brought by the Arizona Department of Financial Institutions before it merged with the Department of Insurance.

Agency: Hawaii Department of Commerce and Consumer Affairs

Company: Allied Interstate LLC and Receivables Management Services Corp.
Description: Allied Interstate and RMSC agreed to pay $500,000 to five states (Connecticut, Idaho, Massachusetts, Minnesota and North Dakota) to resolve allegations that the companies violated debt collection and Do Not Call regulations.
